intro: Dombeya bemarivensis var. humbertii, commonly known as the Madagascar dombeya, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are simple, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. This species is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Madagascar and is often found in forested areas.
